issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.
issuetype.name: New Feature

fields.summary: Use org.junit package instead of junit.framework in TestCombineFileInputFormat

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
The error msg:
{noformat}
testSplitPlacementForCompressedFiles(org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.lib.input.TestCombineFileInputFormat)  Time elapsed: 2.487 sec  <<< FAILURE!

	at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:57)

	at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:57)

	at org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.lib.input.TestCombineFileInputFormat.testSplitPlacement(TestCombineFileInputFormat.java:368)
{noformat}

comments.body: The test unintentionally relies the iteration order of {{HashMap.entrySet()}}. Therefore the test fails in JDK8. {{MAPREDUCE-6165-reproduce.patch}} can reproduce the failure on JDK7.
Resubmitting.

{color:red}-1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12685053/MAPREDUCE-6165-001.patch
  against trunk revision 6583ad1.

                  org.apache.hadoop.conf.TestJobConf

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/5169//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-MAPREDUCE-Build/5169//console

This message is automatically generated.

bq. Why not using assertEquals(2, splits.size())?
split.size() can be 1 or 2. The size depends on the ordering.

bq. I think some applications depend on the ordering...maybe it would be good to use TreeMap<K,V> or LinkedHashMap<K, V> instead of HashMap.
I'm thinking using TreeMap or LinkedHashMap fixes the test but it's useless for production.
s/it's not decision/ it's not good decision/
Make sense to me. I'll update the patch.

Attaching a patch to
* Use original tests as possible
* Clean up the test to use org.junit instead of junit.framework (TestCombineFileInputFormat used both packages)

I verified the test passed with JDK8.
